Dating: BYZANTINE PERIOD (not before); COPTIC PERIOD ?; COPTIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Phial
Description: One of the sides of this phial in terracotta shows the traditional motif of Saint Menas, standing, in a roman costume. The other side bears in a  medallion a short Greek inscription: "eulogy of Saint Menas". The piece, which is intact, but whose motifs are very effaced, dates from the 6th or the 7th century.
